Body:
I was wondering if there were any current models that measured the effect of cultural shifts in a given language. Specifically, is there consistent/model-able lag between major cultural events and how it affects a language.

In my instance, I am thinking in terms of the spread of Hellenism which resulted in the adoption of (Attic/Ionic -> Koine) Greek as lingua franca for a discernible period of time. Is there an existing way to measure/model the influence of Alexander's conquered areas on the "base" language? When did any Balkan influence appear? Asian?
Title: Is there a way to measure culture's impact on a language?
